snippet.title: Trainee pilot dies after ultralight crash in Melbourne's south-east
snippet.content:
Related Story:
The trainee pilot of an ultralight plane that crashed during a training flight at Clyde North, south-east of Melbourne earlier this week has died in hospital. Emergency services were called to the scene at Pound Road and Hardys Road about 10:40am on Thursday. The man, a 19-year-old Chinese national and his instructor, a 25-year-old Newry man, were airlifted to hospital with serious injuries. His instructor remains in hospital. Victoria Police said the cause of the crash was yet to be determined and would be investigated by Recreation Aviation Australia.
